event.title: accompanied Nicolas Simon back to Hartford in 1844

data.event: James and Charles Rossman accompanied Nicolas Simon back to Hartford in 1844, and soon bought 40 acres around the rapids of the Rubicon River.
Rails were laid in 1855 that linked Chicago, Milwaukee, La Crosse and Minneapolis until the early 1900s.

event.title: linked Chicago, Milwaukee, La Crosse and Minneapolis until the early 1900s

data.event: Rails were laid in 1855 that linked Chicago, Milwaukee, La Crosse and Minneapolis until the early 1900s.
When they arrived in what is now Hartford there was nothing but dense virgin forest and wild prairie.
